definition: to put up a guest/to stay overnight
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve

sentences.english: Fancy hotels are beginning to accommodate both man and pets.
sentences.chinese: 一些別出心裁的飯店已經開始同時留宿人和寵物。

sentences.english: She helped clean and cook to pay for her stay.
sentences.chinese: 她靠幫忙打掃和做飯來支付她的留宿。

sentences.english: We must have no guests to stay in the house.
sentences.chinese: 我們不希望客人在家中留宿。

sentences.english: We stayed 6 nights in Marriott Resort&Spa before continuing to Southern Thailand.
sentences.chinese: 我們在泰國南部的萬豪酒店留宿了6天。

sentences.english: College should give them the intellectual equivalent of their childhood sleepover experience.
sentences.chinese: 大學應該在理性層面，給人如童年時在外留宿的經歷。

sentences.english: I'd offer to make love with you even if I couldn't stay the night.
sentences.chinese: 即使你不留宿我，我也樂意與你如此。

sentences.english: So they've got soccer, they've got basketball, they go sleep over at their friend's houses。
sentences.chinese: 所以她們可以去踢足球，打籃球，或者在朋友家留宿。

sentences.english: If you want to stay overnight, please contact us via email.
sentences.chinese: 想留宿者請通過電郵聯絡兜率天。

sentences.english: Please make your own arrangements for accommodations.
He stayed in a caravan for the night.
sentences.chinese: 古早他留在一個大旅舍裏留宿。

sentences.english: That evening he told Linda they were having a house guest.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，他告訴琳達他們有客人要留宿。

sentences.english: Relatives and friends are not allowed to stay overnight.
sentences.chinese: 不得留宿非住宿生或親友。

definition: to stay with sb/to ask for lodging
to sleep outdoors/to spend the night in the open
to stay (at a hotel etc during a trip)
to visit/to call on sb/to look around
a single man and a single woman/bachelors/a man and a woman together (typically in a secluded setting)
to entertain (for dinner)/to invite to dinner
